project_abstract.cdata: The First Livestock Project is designed to develop livestock production and to improve the nutrition and living conditions of one of the poorest segments of the population in C.A.E: the M'Bororoherdsmen. The project will consist of the following four main components: (i) provision of animal health services in the western half of the country; (ii) strengthening of the Government's Livestock Service; (iii) introduction and testing of simple pasture management techniques, based on herdsmen's associations in pilot zones; and (iv) studies and surveys of animal health problems, pasture resources and sector development strategy, including preparation of a follow-up project.
